Synchronizing Users

The StarTeam Microsoft Project Integration allows you to add StarTeam users as resources in a Microsoft Project (.mpp) file so that the same names can be used in both applications. Because of the importance of this step, the StarTeam menu in Microsoft Project initially displays only the Sync StarTeam Users command. Do not assign resources to tasks until you have imported users from StarTeam.

When users are added manually to Microsoft Project, StarTeam does not recognize them. Tasks that contain resources unknown to StarTeam have no resources assigned to them when they are exported to StarTeam.

Caution: If square brackets appear around a StarTeam user name, Microsoft Project does not accept the name as a resource, due to the use of invalid characters.

If you manage more than one project, but staff those projects with the same users, you should create a single resource pool in Microsoft Project after synchronizing users. Doing this allows you to:

  • Review resource usage and costs across projects.

  • Quickly add shared resources to a new project.

  • Identify and resolve resource over-allocation problems.

  • Print resource reports across projects.

To synchronize users:

  1. From Microsoft Project, open the .mpp file to be used with StarTeam. It is best not to use a consolidated project, which has other project files as subprojects, or a linked project, which has links to tasks in other project files.

  2. Select StarTeam > Sync StarTeam Users from the Microsoft Project menu bar. The Connection Wizard: Select Server dialog appears.

    1. If the server you need is not listed in the dialog, add it. See Accessing StarTeam Servers.

    2. Select the appropriate server description from the list.

    3. Click Next. The Log On to <server description name> dialog appears.

  3. In the Log On dialog:

    1. Enter your user name and password.

    2. Click OK. The Users and Resources dialog appears. It displays a list of current StarTeam users.

  4. Do one of the following:

    • Select specific users from the Users To Import list

    • Choose Select All to include all users in the Users To Import list.

  5. Click Import. If prompted, save your .mpp file. The selected users are added to the Existing Resources list box.

  6. Click Close. This action adds the StarTeam user list to your Microsoft Project resource sheet. You can now assign them to Microsoft Project tasks.

After completing this procedure, you will not have to synchronize users again, unless you need to add more users or to change the address of the StarTeam server. In either case, you must reopen the mpp file, select StarTeam > Sync StarTeam Users, and proceed as described above.

When you create a new Microsoft project, you can use the StarTeam resources that were previously added by sharing.

To share pooled resources in Microsoft Project:

  1. In Microsoft Project, select Tools > Resources > Share Resources. The Share Resources dialog appears.

  2. Select the Use Resources option button.

  3. From the drop-down list box, select the StarTeam resource pool file that you have created.

  4. Click OK.
